intro: Tephrosia humbertii, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant features compound leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its roots contain compounds that have been traditionally used in local medicine. Tephrosia humbertii plays a role in soil enrichment and serves as a valuable resource in ecological and agricultural contexts.
